title: Add tests verifying no API calls after initial sync
description:
Add integration tests that verify read methods do NOT make API calls after the initial sync.

**Test approach:**
1. Perform initial sync (full budget fetch)
2. Call each read method
3. Verify no additional API calls were made (check MSW handler call counts or similar)

**Methods to test:**
- getTransactions()
- getTransaction()
- getScheduledTransactions()
- getBudgetMonths()
- getBudgetMonth()
- getAccounts() (already works, verify)
- getCategories() (already works, verify)
- getPayees() (already works, verify)

**Also verify:**
- Enriched data matches what API would return
- Filters work correctly with local data

**File:** src/ynab-client.test.ts

title: Tool authorization (canAccess) for fine-grained permissions
description:
FastMCP supports canAccess for fine-grained tool authorization.

Could enable:
- Per-tool permissions beyond just read-only mode
- User-specific access controls
- Audit logging for sensitive operations

Low priority - current YNAB_READ_ONLY and YNAB_BUDGET_ID constraints are sufficient for personal use.

title: MCP Prompts for common workflows
description:
Add reusable MCP prompt templates for common YNAB workflows:

- Transaction categorization workflow
- Month-end budget review
- Spending analysis
- Reconciliation guidance

Prompts help LLMs follow consistent patterns for complex multi-step operations.

title: v1.0 Release: Functional server for personal use + npm publish
description: Milestone epic representing the first public release. Server should be stable, well-tested, and ready for real-world YNAB workflows. Future enhancements (OAuth, prompts, etc.) are blocked until this is complete.

title: Streaming for large result sets
description:
For very large budgets (20-50MB), streaming results could reduce memory usage and improve responsiveness.

Lower priority - in-memory approach works fine for typical budgets.

title: Epic: Reconciliation workflow tools
description:
Build tools to assist with YNAB account reconciliation - the most critical workflow for maintaining budget accuracy.

Potential tools from design doc:
- prepare_reconciliation(account_id, external_balance) - compare balances, identify discrepancies
- import_external_transactions(account_id, data, format) - parse CSV/OFX/QFX bank exports
- compare_transactions(account_id, session_id) - match YNAB vs bank transactions
- create_missing_transactions() - add transactions found in bank but not YNAB
- resolve_duplicate() - handle duplicate detection
- complete_reconciliation() - finalize and lock transactions

Next action: Scope out the specific tools needed and define MVP vs nice-to-have.

Reference: docs/plans/2026-01-19_ynab-workflows-mcp-design.md (Reconciliation section)

title: Testing infrastructure improvements
description:
Build better tests and testing infrastructure so Claude can operate more autonomously without manual verification.

Current gaps:
- Many features could break without test coverage
- Heavy reliance on MSW mocks that may not match real API behavior
- No integration/E2E tests against real (test) YNAB data

Goals:
- Comprehensive unit test coverage for critical paths
- Consider a dedicated test YNAB budget for prod-like testing
- Test harnesses that make it easy to add new tests
- Tests that catch regressions before they ship

This enables more confident autonomous development.

title: Epic: Categorization workflow tools
description:
Build tools to assist with transaction categorization - a natural fit for LLM assistance.

Potential tools from design doc:
- suggest_categories(transaction_ids) - AI-ready category suggestions based on payee patterns
- get_categories_for_selection() - category list with context (common payees, balances)
- bulk_categorize_transactions(categorizations) - apply categories to multiple transactions
- apply_categorization_rule(payee_pattern, category_id) - auto-categorization rules

LLMs excel at:
- Pattern recognition in cryptic payee names (AMZN*123ABC -> Amazon)
- Context awareness from transaction history
- Learning user preferences over time

Next action: Scope out MVP tools and integration with existing transaction tools.

Reference: docs/plans/2026-01-19_ynab-workflows-mcp-design.md (Categorization section)

title: Epic: Migrate read methods to use LocalBudget
description:
5 of 8 read methods in ynab-client.ts still make direct API calls instead of reading from LocalBudget. This defeats the primary goal of the whole-budget caching system.

**Methods needing migration:**
- getTransactions() - calls api.transactions.getTransactions()
- getTransaction() - calls api.transactions.getTransactionById()
- getScheduledTransactions() - calls api.scheduledTransactions.getScheduledTransactions()
- getBudgetMonths() - calls api.months.getBudgetMonths()
- getBudgetMonth() - calls api.months.getBudgetMonth()

**Root cause:** Full budget endpoint returns TransactionSummary (IDs only), but we need enriched data with resolved names. Need to create enrichTransactionSummary() helper.

**Already working:** getAccounts(), getCategories(), getPayees()

See: docs/plans/2026-01-25_whole-budget-caching-delta-sync.md "Read Method Migration Status"

title: Migrate getTransactions() to use LocalBudget
description:
Refactor getTransactions() to read from localBudget.transactions instead of calling api.transactions.getTransactions().

**Current behavior:** Makes API call, then enriches result
**Target behavior:** Read from LocalBudget, filter locally, enrich with helper

**Local filtering needed:**
- accountId filter
- sinceDate filter  
- type=uncategorized (no category_id)
- type=unapproved (approved=false)

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (lines ~687-723)
**Depends on:** enrichTransactionSummary() helper

title: Add sync history cleanup (delete old files)
description:
The sync history files in ~/.config/ynab-mcp-deluxe/sync-history/ will accumulate over time. Add cleanup logic to delete files older than X days.

**Considerations:**
- Default retention: 30 days?
- Make configurable via env var?
- Run cleanup on startup or periodically?

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (sync history persistence code)
**Priority:** Low - only becomes an issue with heavy usage

title: YNAB context/guide for LLMs
description:
The LLM using this server needs to understand YNAB deeply: the Four Rules, how categories/budgeting works, common patterns, and anti-patterns to avoid.

Options to explore:
- A get_ynab_guide tool that returns educational context on demand
- An MCP Resource that exposes YNAB methodology documentation
- An MCP Prompt template for 'YNAB assistant' persona
- Including it in the server description (may be too verbose)

Goal: Help LLMs give better YNAB advice without requiring users to explain YNAB methodology.

title: Progress reporting for long operations
description:
Use FastMCP's reportProgress() for long-running operations:

- Backing up multiple budgets
- Large transaction queries
- Bulk transaction updates

Provides better UX for operations that take noticeable time.

title: Custom logger for server-side logging
description:
Investigate custom logging configuration beyond FastMCP's built-in context logger.

May be useful for:
- Structured logging to files
- Log levels per module
- Integration with observability tools

Low priority - current logging approach works fine.

title: Implement StaticSyncProvider for offline testing
description:
The StaticSyncProvider in sync-providers.ts is currently a stub that throws an error. Implement it to load budget data from a static JSON file.

**Purpose:** Enable offline testing and development without hitting the real YNAB API

**Implementation:**
- Read JSON file from YNAB_STATIC_BUDGET_FILE env var
- Parse as BudgetDetail response
- Return in fullSync()
- deltaSync() could return empty delta or throw (static data doesnt change)

**File:** src/sync-providers.ts (lines ~65-107)
**Related:** Phase 10 Static JSON Testing (ynab-mcp-deluxe-hid)

title: Validate delta sync with real YNAB API
description:
Manual testing needed to verify delta sync behavior against real YNAB API. Key questions to validate:

1. Does GET /budgets/{id}?last_knowledge_of_server=X actually return only changed entities?
2. When entities are deleted, does the API return them with deleted: true?
3. Does the delta response structure match full budget structure?
4. Does our mergeEntityArray() produce the same result as a full re-fetch?

All testing so far has been with MSW mocks, NOT the real API. This is marked CRITICAL in the delta sync scratchpad.

Reference: docs/plans/2026-01-25_whole-budget-caching-delta-sync.md (Post-Implementation Analysis section)

title: Query parameter improvements (reduce JMESPath reliance)
description:
Add dedicated parameters for common filters to reduce reliance on JMESPath expressions.

Potential additions:
- approved: boolean filter
- cleared: filter by cleared status
- flag_color: filter by flag
- amount_min/amount_max: amount range filtering
- field projection: select which fields to return

JMESPath is powerful but adds complexity for common use cases. Native parameters would be more intuitive for LLMs.

Reference: docs/plans/2026-01-24_query-parameters-vs-jmespath.md

title: Static JSON Testing Mode (Phase 10)
description:
Replace real YNAB API with static JSON files for testing. Enables:

1. Deterministic testing - same data every time, no network dependency
2. Offline development - work without YNAB API access
3. Large budget simulation - test with realistic 20-50MB budgets
4. Edge case testing - craft specific scenarios (deletions, splits, etc.)
5. CI/CD friendly - no secrets needed for testing

Environment variable: YNAB_STATIC_BUDGET_FILE=/path/to/test-budget.json

Implementation:
- StaticJsonSyncProvider class in sync-providers.ts
- isStaticJsonMode() helper
- Block write operations with clear error in static mode
- Sample test JSON file in data/example/

Detailed plan: docs/plans/2026-01-25_whole-budget-caching-delta-sync.md (Phase 10 section)

title: OAuth authentication support
description:
Currently using environment variable (YNAB_ACCESS_TOKEN) for API authentication. OAuth flow would provide:

- Better user experience (no manual token management)
- Token refresh handling
- Multi-user scenarios

FastMCP has built-in OAuth support with providers and PKCE - investigate using this.

Not essential for personal use but valuable for broader adoption.

title: Create enrichTransactionSummary() helper method
description:
Create a helper method that transforms TransactionSummary → EnrichedTransaction using LocalBudget lookup maps.

**Input:** TransactionSummary (from full budget endpoint - has IDs only)
**Output:** EnrichedTransaction (with resolved names, currency formatting, subtransactions)

**Must resolve using lookup maps:**
- account_id → account_name (via accountById)
- payee_id → payee_name (via payeeById)  
- category_id → category_name, category_group_name (via categoryById, categoryGroupNameById)

**Must also:**
- Join subtransactions from flat array back to parent transaction
- Apply currency formatting via toCurrency()
- Handle null/undefined IDs gracefully

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts
**Depends on:** LocalBudget lookup maps (already implemented)

title: Epic: Budget catch-up workflow tools
description:
Build tools to help users who have neglected their budget catch up systematically.

Potential tools from design doc:
- assess_budget_state() - comprehensive status for catch-up planning
- generate_catch_up_plan(strategy) - actionable step-by-step plan
- get_month_summary(month) - quick view of specific month's state

Workflow:
1. Assess gap duration and accounts needing attention
2. Generate prioritized catch-up plan
3. Guide through reconciliation for each account
4. Bulk categorization of outstanding transactions
5. Address overspending and budget current month

Next action: Scope out MVP tools and determine dependencies on reconciliation/categorization tools.

Reference: docs/plans/2026-01-19_ynab-workflows-mcp-design.md (Budget Catch-Up section)

title: Migrate getBudgetMonths() to use LocalBudget
description:
Refactor getBudgetMonths() to read from localBudget.months instead of calling api.months.getBudgetMonths().

**Current behavior:** Makes API call
**Target behavior:** Read directly from LocalBudget.months array

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (lines ~1131-1153)
**Note:** Months data should already be complete in LocalBudget

title: Migrate getTransaction() to use LocalBudget
description:
Refactor getTransaction() to find transaction in localBudget.transactions instead of calling api.transactions.getTransactionById().

**Current behavior:** Makes API call for single transaction
**Target behavior:** Find in LocalBudget array, enrich with helper

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (lines ~1066-1079)
**Depends on:** enrichTransactionSummary() helper

title: Migrate getScheduledTransactions() to use LocalBudget
description:
Refactor getScheduledTransactions() to read from localBudget.scheduledTransactions instead of calling api.scheduledTransactions.getScheduledTransactions().

**Current behavior:** Makes API call, then enriches result
**Target behavior:** Read from LocalBudget, enrich with lookup maps

**May need:** Similar enrichment helper for scheduled transactions

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (lines ~1084-1126)
**Depends on:** LocalBudget lookup maps

title: Migrate getBudgetMonth() to use LocalBudget
description:
Refactor getBudgetMonth() to find specific month in localBudget.months instead of calling api.months.getBudgetMonth().

**Current behavior:** Makes API call for single month
**Target behavior:** Find in LocalBudget.months array by date

**File:** src/ynab-client.ts (lines ~1158-1211)
**Note:** May need to handle month lookup by date string matching
